element.name: Bond of the Talisman
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Talisman
element.prerequisite: 12th-level warlock, Pact of the Talisman feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 12th-level warlock, Pact of the Talisman feature

While someone else is wearing your talisman, you can use your action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you. The teleportation can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: While someone else is wearing your talisman, teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you.

description.p: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

element.name: Far Scribe
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Tome

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level warlock, Pact of the Tome
A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

You can cast the sending spell, targeting a creature whose name is on the page, without using a spell slot and without using material components. To do so, you must write the message on the page. The target hears the message in their mind, and if the target replies, their message appears on the page, rather than in your mind. The writing disappears after 1 minute.
As an action, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

sheet.description: A creature can write its name on your book. Can cast sending spell targeting a creature you have written down without using a spell slot nor material components. You write the message on the book and, if replied, it shows on book for a minute before disappearing. As an action, you can erase a name.

element.name: Gift of the Protectors
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Tome
element.prerequisite: 9th level, Pact of the Tome feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level, Pact of the Tome feature
A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to O hit points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 hit point instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a long rest.
As an action, you can magically erase a namse on the page by touching it.

sheet.description: A creature can write its name on your book. When a creature whose name is on the book drops to 0 hit points but not killed outright, drop to 1 hp instead. Once this trigger is used, no one else can benefit after a long rest.

element.name: Investment of the Chain Master
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Chain

description.p: When you cast find familiar, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits:

ul.li: The familiar gains either a flying speed or a swimming speed (your choice) of 40 feet.
As a bonus action, you can command the familiar to take the Attack action.
The familiar's weapon attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks.
If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.
When the familiar takes damage, you can use your reaction to grant it resistance against that damage.

sheet.description: When casting find familiar, the summoned creature get additional benefits from your eldritch power.

element.name: Protection of the Talisman
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Talisman
element.prerequisite: 7th-level warlock, Pact of the Talisman feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 7th-level warlock, Pact of the Talisman feature

When the wearer of your talisman fails a saving throw, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When wearer of talisman fails a saving throw, they can add d4 to the roll, potentially making it a success.

element.name: Rebuke of the Talisman
element.supports: Eldritch Invocation, Pact of the Talisman

description.p: When the wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to your proficiency bonus and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

sheet.description: When wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 ft of you, deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to {{proficiency}} and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

description.p: You can cast animate dead without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.
